intro: Tournonia leptostachys, commonly known as the slender-stemmed tournonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of bright yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable choice for gardens in warm climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated for its vibrant blooms and compact size.
